706782f-a.text:
Shore Road, west side, from 85th to 83rd Streets, showing the Crescent Athletic Club, opposite 83rd Street, which was destroyed by fire in April 1933.
About 1918.
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.

706781f-a.text:
Shore Road, west side, opposite 83rd Street, showing the Crescent Athletic Club's boat-house, which was destroyed by fire in April 1933. This organization has its origin in a football club, organized in 1884 by William H. Ford, and was on leased grounds located at the corner of 9th Ave and 9th Street, Brooklyn. The club v ich was incorporated in Feb. 1888, took over in the spring of 1889 the land and boat-house of the Nereid Boat Club. In the same year they purchased from the Van Brunt and Bergen estates of Bay Ridge a tract of land extending from 83rd to 85th Streets, and from Shore Road to Colonial Road. On Decoration Day 1892, the club house which cost $80,O00 was opened to the members.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
